Definition.Document:
Compressor Analysis

Workbook Overview

This workbook is divided into multiple worksheets to organize various steps of the analysis. Each worksheet contains a journal with a description of the analysis steps taken on that worksheet. Here is a high level overview of the workbook:

  1. Load and cleanse data
  2. Perform first principal calculations used to analyze compressors
  3. Visualize operation relative to the operating curve on an x-y plot
  4. Flag when operation deviates consistently beyond a given bound
  5. Predict when the compressor needs to be taken offline for maintenance

Starting Signals

  • Discharge Pressure (C23)
  • Discharge Temperature (C23)
  • Suction Pressure (C23)
  • Suction Temperature (C23)
  • Flow (C23)
  • Speed (C23)

Starting Point Workstep

Cleanse Data

1. Use Value Search to identify periods when Not Flowing. Look for periods when the flow rate is below 100MMSCFD (note that Seeq writes MMSCFD as Mcf/d).(workstep)

2. Use Formula to remove the periods when there is no flow.  (workstep)

Suction:

  • 1ST STAGE COMP SUCTION PRESSURE
  • 1ST STAGE COMP SUCTION TEMPERATURE

Discharge:

  • 1ST STAGE COMP DISCHARGE PRESSURE
  • 1ST STAGE COMP DISCHARGE TEMPERATURE

Other:

  • 1ST STAGE COMP DISCHARGE FLOW
  • 1ST STAGE COMP SPEED

Global Parameters

These affect all the calculations and analysis in this workbook

gas_composition

Mechanical losses (compressor and motor)

thermo_script_name

thermo_script_name

コンプレッサーの解析

ワークブックの概要

このワークブックは、解析の様々なステップを整理するために、複数のワークシートに分かれています。各ワークシートには、そのワークシートで行われた解析ステップの説明が記載されたジャーナルが含まれています。以下は、ワークブックの概要です。

  1. データのロードとクレンジング
  2. 圧縮機の解析に使用される第一主計算の実行
  3. 動作曲線に対する動作をX-Yプロットで可視化
  4. 動作がある境界を越えて一貫して逸脱している場合にフラグを立てる
  5. メンテナンスのためにコンプレッサをオフラインにする必要があるときを予測する

Starting Signals

  • Discharge Pressure (C23)
  • Discharge Temperature (C23)
  • Suction Pressure (C23)
  • Suction Temperature (C23)
  • Flow (C23)
  • Speed (C23)

Starting Point Workstep

Cleanse Data

1. Use Value Search to identify periods when Not Flowing. Look for periods when the flow rate is below 100MMSCFD (note that Seeq writes MMSCFD as Mcf/d). (workstep)

2. Use Formula to remove the periods when there is no flow. (workstep)

Suction:

  • 1ST STAGE COMP SUCTION PRESSURE
  • 1ST STAGE COMP SUCTION TEMPERATURE

Discharge:

  • 1ST STAGE COMP DISCHARGE PRESSURE
  • 1ST STAGE COMP DISCHARGE TEMPERATURE

Other:

  • 1ST STAGE COMP DISCHARGE FLOW
  • 1ST STAGE COMP SPEED

Global Parameters

These affect all the calculations and analysis in this workbook

gas_composition

thermo_script_name

Compressor Analysis

Workbook Overview

This workbook is divided into multiple worksheets to organize various steps of the analysis. Each worksheet contains a journal with a description of the analysis steps taken on that worksheet. Here is a high level overview of the workbook:

  1. Load and cleanse data
  2. Perform first principal calculations used to analyze compressors
  3. Visualize operation relative to the operating curve on an x-y plot
  4. Flag when operation deviates consistently beyond a given bound
  5. Predict when the compressor needs to be taken offline for maintenance

Starting Signals

  • Discharge Pressure (C23)
  • Discharge Temperature (C23)
  • Suction Pressure (C23)
  • Suction Temperature (C23)
  • Flow (C23)
  • Speed (C23)

Starting Point Workstep

Cleanse Dataクレンジング

1. 値検索を使用して、Not Flowingの期間を特定します。流量が100MMSCFD以下の期間を探します。（SeeqではMMSCFDをMcf/dと表記）(workstep)

2. 1で特定した期間を削除します。 (workstep)

Suction:

  • 1ST STAGE COMP SUCTION PRESSURE
  • 1ST STAGE COMP SUCTION TEMPERATURE

Discharge:

  • 1ST STAGE COMP DISCHARGE PRESSURE
  • 1ST STAGE COMP DISCHARGE TEMPERATURE

Other:

  • 1ST STAGE COMP DISCHARGE FLOW
  • 1ST STAGE COMP SPEED

グローバルパラメータ

このワークブックのすべての計算と分析に影響します。

gas_composition
